43 int Pairs::setPairs_BC()
44 {
45  vector<vector<int>>::iterator it;
46  vector<int> opairs(4); //one pair, always containing two integers (tasks' ids) + an order of a pair, when setted by the preVar method + the type of the pair
47 
48  //setting pairs based on the fact if their windows are overlapping. Thus, we need to decide if i precede j, or j precede i
49  for (int i=0; i<numTasks; i++)
50  {
51  for (int j=i+1; j<numTasks; j++)
52  {
53 
54  bool set = false;
55  double ei = tasksToS->at(i)->getEnd();
56  double si = tasksToS->at(i)->getStart();
57  double ej = tasksToS->at(j)->getEnd();
58  double sj = tasksToS->at(j)->getStart();
59 
60  double overlap = min(ei,ej) - max(si,sj);
61 
62  //I before J, or I after J there is no overlap and we dont want to add the pair.
63  //for other cases, we would like to add some constraint
64 
65  if(overlap > 0)
66  {
67  opairs[0] = i;
68  opairs[1] = j;
69  opairs[2] = -1;
70  opairs[3] = 2; //2 - any combination of tasks is possible
71  set = true;
72  }
73 
74  if(set)
75  {
76  it = pairs.begin() + numPairs;
77  pairs.insert(it,opairs);
78  numPairs++;
79  }
80  }
81  }
82  return numPairs;
83 }
84 
91 int decidedInterval(Task * i, Task * j, double distij, double distji)
92 {
93  double si = i->getStart();
94  double ei = i->getEnd();
95  double di = i->getDuration();
96 
97  double sj = j->getStart();
98  double ej = j->getEnd();
99  double dj = j->getDuration();
100 
101  double ij = di+dj+distij;
102  double ji = di+dj+distji;
103 
104  //old version
105  //double overlap = min(ei,ej) - max(si,sj);
106  double overlap1 = ej-si;
107  double overlap2 = ei-sj;
108 
109 
110  if((ij<=overlap1)&&(ji<=overlap2)) //both combinations are possible
111  {
112  return 2;
113  }
114  else
115  {
116  if(ij<=overlap1) //only combination that i precedes j is possbile during overlap
117  {
118  return 1;
119  }
120  else if(ji<=overlap2) //only combination that j precedes i
121  {
122  return 0;
123  }
124  else
125  {
126  return -1; //there is a flaw in input data, both combinations are not possible
127  }
128  }
129 
130 
131 }
132 
139 int chooseInt(int time_ij, int time_ji)
140 {
141  if(time_ij < time_ji)
142  {
143  return 1;
144  }
145  else
146  {
147  return 0;
148  }
149 }

156 int Pairs::setPairs_new(double ** dist_a)
157 {
158  vector<vector<int>>::iterator it;
159  vector<int> opairs(4); //one pair, always containing two integers + order of pair, when setted by preVar method + the type of pair
160 
161  //setting pairs based on the fact if their windows are overlapping. Thus we need to decide if i precede j, or j precede i
162  for (int a=0; a<numTasks; a++)
163  {
164  for (int b=a+1; b<numTasks; b++)
165  {
166 
167  bool set = false;
168  Task * i = tasksToS->at(a);
169  Task * j = tasksToS->at(b);
170 
171  double ei = i->getEnd();
172  double si = i->getStart();
173  double di = i->getDuration();
174  double ej = j->getEnd();
175  double sj = j->getStart();
176  double dj = j->getDuration();
177 
178  double distij = dist_a[a][b];
179  double distji = dist_a[b][a];
180 
181  double time_ij = si+di+distij - sj;
182  double time_ji = sj+dj+distji - si;
183 
184  if (time_ij <0)
185  time_ij = 0;
186  if (time_ji <0)
187  time_ji = 0;
188 
189  //the combination of tasks is possible
190  opairs[0] = a;//tasksToS->at(i)->getID();
191  opairs[1] = b;//tasksToS->at(j)->getID();
192  opairs[2] = -1; // this will be set in preVar method
193  opairs[3] = -1;
194 
195 
196  /*
197  I before J, or I after J there is no overlapp and we dont want to add any constrain
198  If task I ends after task J starts,
199  thus they overlap in certain way,
200  and we need to add constrain to ensure, that their execution will not overlap*/
201  if(ei>sj)
202  {
203  //i overlaps j
204  if((si<sj)&&(ei<ej))
205  {
206  opairs[3] = 1;
207  set = true;
208  }
209 
210  //i starts j, equal
211  else if(si==sj)
212  {
213  if(ei<ej) //i starts j
214  {
215  opairs[3] = 1;
216  set = true;
217  }
218 
219  else if (ei==ej)//equals
220  {
221  /*
222  the pair should be of type 2 (any combination), but if intervals are same and we are not using any priority,
223  it makes no sense to chose ordering,
224  however, dist(i,j) or dist(j,i) can be different and they might change the ordering.
225  Thus, we decide here which is the best ordering */
226  opairs[3]=decidedInterval(i,j,distij, distji);
227  if(opairs[3] == 2)
228  opairs[3] = chooseInt(time_ij, time_ji);
229 
230  set = true;
231  }
232  }
233  //j during i
234  else if((si<sj)&&(ei>ej))
235  {
236  //both options (i precedes j, j precedes i) are generally possible
237  opairs[3]=decidedInterval(i,j,distij, distji);
238  //this is really pruning
239  if(opairs[3] == 2)
240  opairs[3] = chooseInt(time_ij, time_ji);
241  set = true;
242  }
243  //i finish j
244  else if((ei == ej)&&(si<sj))
245  {
246  opairs[3]=1;
247  set = true;
248  }
249  }
250  if(ej>si)
251  {
252  //j overlaps i
253  if((sj<si)&&(ej<ei))
254  {
255  opairs[3] = 0;
256  set = true;
257  }
258 
259  else if((si==sj)&&(ej < ei)) //i imeets j
260  {
261  opairs[3]= 0;
262  set = true;
263  }
264  //i during j
265  else if((sj<si)&&(ej>ei))
266  {
267  opairs[3]= decidedInterval(i,j,distij, distji);
268  //this is really pruning
269  if(opairs[3] == 2)
270  opairs[3] = chooseInt(time_ij, time_ji);
271  set = true;
272  }
273  else if((ei == ej)&&(sj<si))
274  {
275  opairs[3]= 0;
276  set = true;
277  }
278  }
279  if(set)
280  {
281  it = pairs.begin() + numPairs;
282  pairs.insert(it,opairs);
283  numPairs++;
284 
285  }
286 
287  }
288  }
289  return numPairs;
290 }
